    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Skeletal Champion</h1>These skeletons retain the cunning they possessed in life.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Undead</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 16<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=373">Skeletal Champion</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 2</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Skeleton_SkeletalChampion.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Skeleton_SkeletalChampion.png"></a><span alt="Neutral Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Evil">NE</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Skeleton Trait" class="trait" title="This undead is made by animating a dead creature’s skeleton with negative energy."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=236">Skeleton</a></span><span alt="Undead Trait" class="trait" title="Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don’t benefit from healing effects."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160">Undead</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 298</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +8; darkvision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=20"><u>Necril</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +8, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=7"><u>Intimidation</a></u> +7<br /><b>Str</b> +4, <b>Dex</b> +4, <b>Con</b> +1, <b>Int</b> -1, <b>Wis</b> +2, <b>Cha</b> +1<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Armor.aspx?ID=9"><u>chain mail</u></a>, <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=28"><u>lance</u></a>, <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=31"><u>longsword</u></a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Shields.aspx?ID=3">steel shield</a> (Hardness 5, HP 20, BT 10)<hr /><b>AC</b> 19 (21 with shield raised), <b>Fort</b> +7, <b>Ref</b> +10, <b>Will</b> +6<br /><b>HP</b> 25 (negative healing); <b>Immunities</b> death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious; <b>Resistances</b> cold 5, electricity 5, fire 5, piercing 5, slashing 5<br /><b>Attack of Opportunity</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"><br /> <b>Shield Block</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"><hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> longsword +10 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=200"><u>versatile P</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d8+4 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> claw +10 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+4 slashing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> lance +10 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=174"><u>deadly d8</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=186"><u>jousting d6</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=192"><u>reach 10 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d8+4 piercing</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=92">Skeleton</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=373">Skeletal Champion</a></td><td>2</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=375">Skeletal Giant</a></td><td>3</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=374">Skeletal Horse</a></td><td>2</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=376">Skeletal Hulk</a></td><td>7</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=372">Skeleton Guard</a></td><td>-1</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=92">Skeleton</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 298</i></a><br />Made from bones held together by foul necromancy, skeletons are among the most common types of undead, found haunting old dungeons and forgotten cemeteries. <h2 class="title">Skeleton Abilities</h2> Most skeletons have one of these abilities. If you give a skeleton more, you might want to increase its level and adjust its statistics.<br /> <b>Bloody</b> The skeleton is covered in dripping blood and gains fast healing equal to its level. <b>Collapse</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Reaction" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\Reaction_I.png"> <b>Trigger</b> The skeleton is critically hit. <b>Effect</b> The skeleton collapses into a pile of bones and the attack deals only normal damage. The skeleton can reform in a standing position as an action, but until it does, it is immobilized and fiat-footed.<br /> <b>Explosive Death</b> When the skeleton is destroyed, its bones shatter and explode as the necromantic energy holding it together is released. Adjacent creatures take 1d6 slashing damage per 2 levels (minimum 1d6) with a basic Reflex save.<br /> <b>Screaming Skull</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png"> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=16">auditory</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=60">emotion</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=68">fear</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=106">mental</a>) The skeleton removes its skull and throws it, making a jaws attack with a range of 20 feet. It then attempts to Demoralize each foe within 10 feet of the target. The head bounces, rolls, or even flies back, returning to the skeleton at the start of its next turn. The skeleton is blind until then.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Unlife without Flesh</h3>The necromantic energies that infuse animated undead skeletons give them the ability to see without eyes and move without muscles. Despite being mindless, skeletons’ instinct to evil comes from their corrupt vital essence, perverting negative energy for creation rather than destruction.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));

      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
